attributes.action: Allow the purchasing of alcohol in hospitality business upon reopening.
attributes.additional_details:
Because alcoholic beverages are the key products to securing the financial stability of the hospitality business. It's the reason people go to them and it's the reason 
the property owners financial stability and  peoples jobs in the hospitality are held secure,  while also help build our economy.  For the government to infringe on peoples  right to chose on wether to indulge these products is a reprehensible infringement on both our civil and fundamental rights.
attributes.background: Allow businesses in the Hospitality sector to continue the sale of alcoholic products upon the reopening of public houses in April.

rejection.details: The Government's Spring 2021 roadmap states that when hospitality opens there will be  no need for customers to order a substantial meal with alcoholic drinks and no curfew, although customers must order, eat and drink while seated: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021/covid-19-response-spring-2021-summary#roadmap-out-of-lockdown
